docs.text: Welcome First of all, you should consider using the Package Manager included with Cesticamea. Cesticamea gets every package from a list hosted here, so manually downloading and installing the packages is more of a waste of time. How to Install Packages For a guide on how to manually install question packages, see this . How to Upload Your Own Packages This process must be handled by Cesticamea. Go to the Package Manager , look for the package you want to upload, and hit the "Upload" button! Note Your package won't be available instantly, it must first pass a verification process. If you uploaded a package and want to see in which stage of verification it is, check out the roadmap . Warning Every verification process can take from some minutes to some hours. Your package can be rejected by any reason. Question Packages Available You can use the search bar to, well... Search for some keywords that you may be interested in. If you don't know what to download, check out the list of question packages available and look out for something!
docs.title: Welcome

docs.title: Question Packages Available

docs.text: How to Install the Packages It is recommended to install every package using the Package Manager inside Cesticamea, as it is the easiest way to do so. Cesticamea gets every package from this exact website and handles the installation process for you, but if you'd like to get more 'technical' , you can download and install everything by yourself! You just need to follow these simple steps: Search for the question package you want and download it. Copy the .JSON file that was downloaded. If you're on a computer, go to the questions folder you specified. If on Android, go to Paste the .JSON file downloaded before. Success You're done! You can now jump right into Cesticamea and play :D Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: How to Install the Packages

Cesticamea gets every package from this exact website and handles the installation process for you, but if you'd like to get more 'technical' , you can download and install everything by yourself! You just need to follow these simple steps: Search for the question package you want and download it. Copy the .JSON file that was downloaded. If you're on a computer, go to the questions folder you specified. If on Android, go to Paste the .JSON file downloaded before. Success You're done! You can now jump right into Cesticamea and play :D
